Description: Unifacial triangular scraper: of black flint, with a coating of dull grey crust on the worked face. The edges have been roughly chipped.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Prof Walter B Emery
Curator's comments: A list of the types of flint implements found in tomb 3505 is given in W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 14-15, but it is so abbreviated as to be of little use.
